title: Ryan Gagliardi Inmate #166819 Parole Determination Records

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Ryan Gagliardi Inmate #166819 Parole Determination Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Complete written decisions and records of parole, parole revocations, parole violations, sentences given for parole violations, deferred explanations, and dates for upcoming parole board hearings scheduled in accordance with any sentence the inmate has served for parole violations for inmate Ryan Gagliardi, ADC # 166819, PID# 0222375, including statements, reasonings, evidence decision was based upon, records, narrative explanation, and all other public records relating to the Parole Board's decision and when new hearing is to be scheduled after parole violation sentence has been served. 


Please note that I am a citizen of Arkansas, and I am using MuckRock's services to help manage and track my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Jenici Lynn Parton.

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Myrtle Beach Police Department)

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Myrtle Beach Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: City of Myrtle Beach, SC. - Police Department Records Request Records Request Confirmation PD-2023-963
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor, 
  
 Thank you for submitting a request for records on Monday, July 17, 2023 at 12:17 AM (Eastern Standard Time). 
  
 Your security key is 514048. 
  
 Your request reference number is Request Number: PD-2023-963. 
  
 Please have this security key and reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 Please note that if you chose not to provide contact information, this reference number should be used when communicating with staff and/or when picking up the records related to this request. Additionally, if no contact information was provided, you must contact the appropriate office to verify receipt of your request, to learn of any applicable fees, and authorize your request to move forward, prior to your request moving forward. 
  
 This request will be processed according to the Freedom of Information Act response timelines. 
  
   
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Myrtle Beach Police Department FOIA Coordinator 
 1101 N Oak St.
Myrtle Beach, SC 29577 
 (843) 918-1535 
 mbpdfoia@cityofmyrtlebeach.com

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policies (Fremont Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau
